intro: Ficus taab, commonly known as the African rubber plant, is a species native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Moraceae family, characterized by its glossy, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are followed by small, round fruits. It is often cultivated as a decorative indoor plant due to its ability to thrive in low-light conditions. Ficus taab is also valued for its potential medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
